page.title: 10BRIDGES STONE continued
page.content: The site also includes the mill owners house,which dates from the late 18th.Century.In was damaged in the floods of 1852 and the front had to be re built.There is an entry in the Alfrick School log for1929 which tells that children had to travel home in a lorry, due to flooding in the area. One of the outbuildings, used in the past for storage, is now known as the "elephant house" because in the last war an elephant was kept there when Chipperfields Circus was billeted in Alfrick. On the Gunnicks mill site now is the Knapp and Papermill Nature Reserve. The old clover and flour mills and the mill owners house are all private homes, not open to the public.The old mill wheels and other items of machinery are still intact,but again are not available for public viewing.
